t: Isaiah 45

The*pn Lord*s says this to Cyrus, his anointed, whose*ln right hand I have grasped to*ln subdue nations before him and*ln disarm kings, to*ln open doors before him, and*ln even city gates will not be shut:
“I*ln will go before you and*ln level the uneven places; I*ln will shatter the bronze doors and*ln cut the iron bars in two.
I*ln will give you the treasures of darkness and*ln riches from secret places, so*ln that you may know that I am the Lord.*s I*ln am the God of Israel, who calls you by your name.
I*ln call you by your name, for*ln the sake of my servant Jacob and*ln Israel my chosen one. I*ln give a name to you, though*ln you do not know me.
I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other; there*ln is no God but me. I*ln will strengthen you, though*ln you do not know me,
so*ln that all may know from the rising of the sun to its setting that*ln there is no one but me. I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other.
I*ln form light and create darkness, I*ln make success and create disaster; I*ln am the Lord,*s who does all these things.

“Heavens,*pn sprinkle from above, and*ln let the skies shower righteousness. Let*ln the earth open up so*ln that salvation will sprout and*ln righteousness will spring up with it. I,*ln the Lord,*s have created it.
“Woe*pn to the one who argues with his Maker — one*ln clay pot among many. Does*ln clay say to the one forming it, ‘What*ln are you making? ’ Or*ln does your work say, ‘He*ln has no hands’?
Woe*ln to the one who says to his father, ‘What*ln are you fathering?’ or*ln to his mother, ‘What*ln are you giving birth to? ’”
This*ln is what the Lord,*s the*ln Holy One of Israel and its Maker, says: “Ask*ln me what is to happen to my sons, and*ln instruct me about the work of my hands.
I*ln made the earth, and*ln created humans on it. It*ln was my hands that stretched out the heavens, and*ln I commanded everything in them.
I*ln have stirred him up in righteousness, and*ln will level all roads for him. He*ln will rebuild my city, and*ln set my exiles free, not*ln for a price or a bribe,” says*ln the Lord*s of Armies.
God Alone Is the Savior

This*p is what the Lord*s says: “The*pn products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush and*ln the Sabeans, men of stature, will*ln come over to you and*ln will be yours; they*ln will follow you, they*ln will come over in chains and*ln bow down to you. They*ln will confess to you, ‘God*ln is indeed with you, and there is no other; there*ln is no other God.’”
Yes,*pn you are a God who hides, God*ln of Israel, Savior.
All*ln of them are put to shame, even humiliated; the*ln makers of idols go in humiliation together.
Israel*ln will be saved by the Lord*s with*ln an everlasting salvation; you*ln will not be put to shame or humiliated for*ln all eternity.

For*pn this is what the Lord*s says — the*ln Creator of the heavens, the*ln God who formed the earth and made it, the*ln one who established it (he*ln did not create it to be a wasteland, but*ln formed it to be inhabited)— he*ln says, “I am the Lord,*s and*ln there is no other.

I*ln have not spoken in secret, somewhere*ln in a land of darkness. I*ln did not say to the descendants of Jacob: Seek*ln me in a wasteland. I*ln am the Lord,*s who speaks righteously, who*ln declares what is right.
“Come,*pn gather together, and*ln approach, you fugitives of the nations. Those*ln who carry their wooden idols and*ln pray to a god who cannot save have*ln no knowledge.

Speak*ln up and present your case— yes,*ln let them consult each other. Who*ln predicted this long ago? Who*ln announced it from ancient times? Was*ln it not I, the Lord?*s There*ln is no other God but me, a*ln righteous God and Savior; there*ln is no one except me.
Turn*ln to me and be saved, all*ln the ends of the earth. For*ln I am God, and*ln there is no other.
By*ln myself I have sworn; truth*ln has gone from my mouth, a*ln word that will not be revoked: Every*ln knee will bow to me, every*ln tongue will swear allegiance.
It*ln will be said about me, ‘Righteousness and strength are*ln found only in the Lord*s .’” All*ln who are enraged against him will*ln come to him and be put to shame.
All*ln the descendants of Israel will*ln be justified and boast in the Lord.*s
